CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 14+P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and Highways expropriated plots of land belonging to the applicant in NORP , GPE . A committee of experts assessed the value of the plots of land belonging to the applicant and compensation was paid to him when the expropriation took place .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant ’s request for increased compensation , ORG awarded him MONEY ( TRL ) of additional compensation plus interest at the statutory rate of PERCENT per annum , namely the rate applicable at the date of the court ’s decision . The date , CARDINAL DATE was fixed by the domestic court for the running of the statutory rate of interest .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon ORG appeal , ORG upheld the decision of the first instance court . On DATE the administration paid the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL as the additional compensation together with interest . The interest on the additional compensation was calculated at the statutory rate applicable between the running date of the interest and DATE , namely PERCENT . As regards the period after DATE the interest was calculated at the then applicable rate , namely PERCENT .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-VI , pp . DATE , § § DATE ) .
